content:
Is there a time for this scheduled yet? Topics for discussion?

I would like to understand the approaches for QR code support.

SHC does its thing with FHIR bundle embedded (with Data Minimization profiles); verifier can be offline assuming they have previously retrieved /.well-known/jwks.json for "trusted" issuers.

https://github.com/ehn-digital-green-development/hcert-spec appears to use json (non-FHIR?) CBOR and Base-45 encoding

WHO SVC may be creating custom FHIR resources https://github.com/who-int/svc/blob/rc2/input/fsh/svc-qr-uvcei.fsh

Then there is the issue of code systems. What about (eventually) PHPID https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/207835-IPS/topic/PHPID

Should we recognize that the verifier is not necessarily the "bouncer" (policy enforcer)
Follow-up session scheduled with IPS today at 1:30-2:30P ET, https://whova.com/portal/webapp/hlsfh_202105/Agenda/1689949
For the call in 20 minutes: I pulled together a rough analysis of issues going from IPS- to SHC-conforming resources:. https://confluence.hl7.org/display/PHWG/2021-05-19+Working+session+with+IPS
Looks good, thanks! I like the :warning:Ô∏èlevel of concern indicator. Will have to borrow that for my own use.
Immunization.protocolAppled is required there - and forbidden by SMART health card
Yes, but it has its own resource profiles - eg https://who-int.github.io/svc/refs/heads/rc2/StructureDefinition-svc-immunization.html - that are based on R4 core now, not IPS
